Package generation

Class Wall

java.lang.Object
generation.Wall
public class Wall extends Object
A wall is a continuous sequence of wallboards in the maze. This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes. Refactored by Peter Kemper

  • Constructor Details

    • Wall

      public Wall​(int startX, int startY, int extensionX, int extensionY, int distance, int cc)
      Constructor assigns parameter values to instance variables.
      Parameters:
      startX - x coordinate of starting position of wall
      startY - y coordinate of starting position of wall
      extensionX - direction and length of wall in x coordinate
      extensionY - direction and length of wall in y coordinate
      distance - of starting position of this wall to exit position of maze
      cc - used to decide which color is assigned to wall, apparently it asks for a color change when a wall is split into two

  • Method Details

    • hasOppositeDirection

      public boolean hasOppositeDirection​(Wall s)
      Tells if the given wall has essentially same direction but for its sign, so it is the opposite (or reversed).
      Parameters:
      s - given wall to compare
      Returns:
      true if given wall has same direction but reversed

    • hasSameDirection

      public boolean hasSameDirection​(Wall s)
      Tells if the given wall has the exact same direction.
      Parameters:
      s - given wall to compare
      Returns:
      true if given wall has exact same direction

    • getDistance

      public int getDistance()
      Returns:
      the distance

    • storeWall

      public void storeWall​(Document doc, Element mazeXML, int number, int i)
      stores fields into the given document with the help of MazeFileWriter.
      Parameters:
      doc - document to add data to
      mazeXML - element to add data to
      number - number for this element
      i - id for this element

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object other)
      Equals method that checks if the other object matches in dimensions and content.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - provides fully functional cells object to compare its content

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Inefficient default implementation of hashCode method. We override the equals method, so it is good practice to do this for the hashCode method as well.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      constant value so hashing works but all entities go to same bin

    • isPartition

      public boolean isPartition()
      Returns:
      the partition

    • setPartition

      public void setPartition​(boolean partition)
      Parameters:
      partition - the partition to set

    • updatePartitionIfBorderCase

      public void updatePartitionIfBorderCase​(int width, int height)
      Sets partition bit to true for cases where the wall touches the border of the maze and has an extension of 0. Method is used in BSPBuilder.
      Parameters:
      width - width of maze * Constants.MAP_UNIT
      height - height of maze * Constants.MAP_UNIT

    • isSeen

      public boolean isSeen()
      Returns:
      if the wall has been seen by the user before

    • setSeen

      public void setSeen​(boolean seen)
      Parameters:
      seen - tells if the wall has been seen by the user before

    • getColor

      public int getColor()
      Returns:
      the color

      public void setColor​(int color)
      Parameters:

      public int getStartPositionX()
      Returns:
      the x

    • getStartPositionY

      public int getStartPositionY()
      Returns:
      the y

    • getExtensionX

      public int getExtensionX()
      Returns:
      the value for length and direction (sign), horizontal

    • getExtensionY

      public int getExtensionY()
      Returns:
      the value for length and direction (sign), vertical

    • getEndPositionY

      public int getEndPositionY()
      A wall has to two ends and this method gives the y coordinate of a position next to one end. Use getY() to get the y coordinate of the starting position.
      Returns:
      the end position +1 in y direction

    • getEndPositionX

      public int getEndPositionX()
      A wall has to two ends and this method gives the x coordinate of a position next to one end. Use getX() to get the y coordinate of the starting position.
      Returns:
      the end position in x direction

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Gets the length of the wall.
      Returns:
      length of wall, value >= 0

    • calculateGrade

      public int calculateGrade​(List<Wall> walls)
      Method called in BSPBuilder.genNodes to determine the minimum of all such grades. The method does not update internal attributes and just calculates the returned value.
      Parameters:
      walls - vector of walls
      Returns:
      undocumented

    • splitWalls

      public void splitWalls​(List<Wall> walls, List<Wall> left, List<Wall> right, int colchange)
      Partitions the given list of walls into left and right walls. This object serves as the splitter.
      Parameters:
      walls - the list of walls to split
      left - the resulting list of walls for the left side of the subtree
      right - the resulting list of walls for the right side of the subtree
